reviews.review: Just beat for the first time, I've been waiting to do this ever since my brother showed me Half-Life and Gmod.  Loved it, gameplay is super enjoyable and rewarding, everything was pretty great, only part I didn't like was Xen, other than that, superb game.

At first I wasn't sure why this game received all the hype that it has but then I took it upon myself to buy this game and see for myself. And let me tell you I was not disappointed. The graphics, I can ignore because this game was released in '99. The lore is what makes this game so good. Its scary, it has some puzzles that forces the player to use his or her brain. And it can also keep the player at the computer for hours. This game will make you not want to leave your computer, seriously. Buy it because its worth the price and the fun and chilling experience that it immerses the player into.

Half-Life was one of the first video games I have ever played on the PC and the immersive experience left a very strong and positive impression on me. I fell in love with this game when I started playing it in the early 2000's; the atmosphere, game-play, and story was very good for its time - I highly recommend it for the nostalgia.

Don't understand the good reviews.  Its essentially impossible to complete the game without reading or watching a game walkthrough in at least several points in the game.  At that point it becomes less of a game and more of an exercise in frustration.  Try getting through the 1st water conveyor belt room without watching a review.  The vast majority of people giving it positive reviews seem to be those who are older and re-experiencing nostalgia from playing it when they were younger.  I didn't play this game "way back yonder", but its repetitive and boring.  About halfway through I kept wondering when it would be over.  I'm not knocking it for its graphics, but for its gameplay.

If you enjoyed Half Life 2, give this one a try. These days it's hard to recommend this game as an entry point to Half Life, but the game still holds up on it's very solid foundation. Weapons feel diverse and responsive and the platforming is a little too floaty, but for it's age is still perfectly serviceable.

If nothing else, this is a landmark FPS shooter and it's worth experiencing at least once. At this price too you might as well give the first few hours a try!

i love the game, i remember in 1997 before alpha 0.52 it was called quiver a very simple quake mod, then it evolved to alpha 0.52, beta 0.61 then the office version then pre-release and now the loved final one, and one of the best things of it is that it has open source sdk, so we players can mod it, thanks valve for bringing this loved game to human world, about the bugs when i change my player model or a keyboard key to do an function, when i save changes the game freezes at level that i need restart my pc, please fix.
